III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical Assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no incidents of maltreatment in care.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one corrective action plan (CAP) this reporting period
due to a special investigation. Special investigation 2024SIC0001557 resulted in a
violation of R.400.4157 (2) (b) and R.400.4158 (1) (a) (ii) with a CAP approved on
11/4/24. The agency fulfilled their CAP by completing training on Crisis prevention
Intervention and Pathways to Resilience: Trauma Responsive Care. The specific
staff involved in the incident was terminated. This CAP is complete and no longer
in the monitoring stage.
2

Financial Overview
Not applicable.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The agency continues to train
staff and review policies and procedures.
Staff and Youth Interviews
There were no concerns noted by staff. Staff were knowledgeable about the youth
in their care and discussed "youth centered" treatment.
Youth were engaged and did not voice any concerns. Youth vocalized feeling safe.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained and clean. Units were decorated well. Staff and
youth were seen engaged in the school classrooms.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
